issues.title: Break out combined plated/non-plated drill files
issues.body:
Thanks for this useful tool!

Fritzing (possibly others) generates a single _drill.txt, and separates the plated and non-plated holes into drill ranges, for example:

```
; NON-PLATED HOLES START AT T1
; THROUGH (PLATED) HOLES START AT T100
M48
INCH
T1C0.040000
T2C0.100000
T100C0.030000
T101C0.036111
T102C0.038000
T103C0.040000
T104C0.042000
T105C0.100000
%
T1
[...]
```

It should be possible to detect the comment header and separate out T1 through T99 into non-plated.

issues.title: Soldermasks have broken recently
issues.body:
In [this directory](https://github.com/sowbug/weblight/tree/master/hardware/mfg/production/0.9.3) there is a zip of Gerber files as well as some images generated by Gerblook on March 26, 2016. If you run that zip through today, you'll note that the soldermask images have the correct board outline but otherwise are missing the actual subtractions from the soldermask.

I noticed this tonight when I was trying to do a new spin of this board. I checked the newest version on http://www.gerber-viewer.com/, and it appears to interpret soldermasks correctly.

issues.title: Check for unsupported 'extended attributes' in the gerber files and complain
issues.body: Looking for the string `\n%TF.` in the file should be enough to detect it?

issues.title: Would be good to have some unittests
issues.body: The `guess_layer` function in [gerber.py](gerber.py) is pretty complicated, it would be nice to have some tests which check additions don't break existing use cases.

commits.message:
Adding support for older KiCad which uses '_' rather then '.'

(Plus tests.)
Check with dash in the name.

Improving the unit test a little.

(Helps with #11.)

Adding support for default KiCad names.

By default KiCad doesn't use the Protel names, instead all the files end in
`.gbr` and it uses 'B.Cu' and similar. (Fixes #12.)

This also adds tests for both the KiCad and Protel file name format.
(Part of #11.)

issues.title: Rectangular apertures in outline break render
issues.body:
Every two weeks, I get a large order from someone who uses "Robot Room Copper Connection": 

  http://www.robotroom.com/CopperConnection/

Sometimes their zips don't render in gerblook.  Through bisection I found the reason.

Here's an outline file that doesn't work:

```
G04 This is an RS-274x file exported by *
G04 gerbv version 2.6A *
G04 More information is available about gerbv at *
G04 http://gerbv.geda-project.org/ *
G04 --End of header info--*
%MOIN*%
%FSLAX34Y34*%
%IPPOS*%
G04 --Define apertures--*
%ADD10R,0.0060X0.0060*%
%ADD11R,0.0070X0.0070*%
G04 --Start main section--*
G54D10*
G01X0000000Y0050790D02*
G01X0080910Y0050790D01*
G01X0080910Y0000000D01*
G01X0000000Y0000000D01*
G01X0000000Y0050790D01*
M02*
```

And here's one that does:

```
G04 This is an RS-274x file exported by *
G04 gerbv version 2.6A *
G04 More information is available about gerbv at *
G04 http://gerbv.geda-project.org/ *
G04 --End of header info--*
%MOIN*%
%FSLAX34Y34*%
%IPPOS*%
G04 --Define apertures--*
%ADD10C,0.0060*%
%ADD11C,0.0070*%
G04 --Start main section--*
G54D10*
G01X0000000Y0050790D02*
G01X0080910Y0050790D01*
G01X0080910Y0000000D01*
G01X0000000Y0000000D01*
G01X0000000Y0050790D01*
M02*
```

The difference is in the aperture definitions:

```
diff -u ../old/nullA_CASE_PANEL_V5.gko nullA_CASE_PANEL_V5.gko
--- ../old/nullA_CASE_PANEL_V5.gko  2016-03-03 00:25:07.494756442 +1100
+++ nullA_CASE_PANEL_V5.gko 2016-03-03 01:07:45.613888540 +1100
@@ -7,8 +7,8 @@
 %FSLAX34Y34*%
 %IPPOS*%
 G04 --Define apertures--*
-%ADD10R,0.0060X0.0060*%
-%ADD11R,0.0070X0.0070*%
+%ADD10C,0.0060*%
+%ADD11C,0.0070*%
 G04 --Start main section--*
 G54D10*
 G01X0000000Y0050790D02*
```

My guess is that the version of gerbv that gerblook's using is too old to support "R"-type rectangular aperture definitions.  ("C"-type circular definitions seem fine)

issues.title: REQ: Project names
issues.body: When logging in you get to see your previous projects however these have just a random name assigned. Is it possible to have the original file name next to them so you can locate previous designs quickly ?

commits.message:
More file endings, .gitignore add for virtualenv

Added more file type endings for automatic mapping, primarily used by
Orcad exports but can be seen a lot. Also updated the FAQ to show that
these endings are supported.

Furthermore added `env/` to .gitignore since it is commonly used vor
virtualenv.

issue_comments.body: Maybe we could make that available as JSON and use the exact same data?

I would suggest you use a URL pointing to a specific version, either through npmcdn or Github (or both?)

https://npmcdn.com/whats-that-gerber@2.0.3/test/filenames-by-cad.js
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tracespace/whats-that-gerber/v2.0.3/test/filenames-by-cad.js

With the npmcdn one you can also put in `@^2.0.3` which will grab newer minor or patch versions (i.e. 2.x.x but not 3.x.x) or `@~2.0.3` which will get newer patch versions (i.e. 2.0.x). I believe `whats-that-gerber` follows [semantic versioning](http://semver.org/) so moving the JSON file should only happen with a major version bump then.
Whats-that-gerber 2.1.0 has been released with the test cases as JSON. I would suggest you use this source: https://npmcdn.com/whats-that-gerber@^2.1.0/test/filenames-by-cad.json

review_comments.body:
Older KiCad uses an underscore (`_`)  in the layer names instead of a dot (`.`). 

Also, check out the [test cases](https://github.com/tracespace/whats-that-gerber/blob/master/test/filenames-by-cad.js) we have come up with for whats-that-gerber.

issue_comments.body:
For providing the whats-that-gerber test cases as JSON, we have a couple options:
1. Convert the existing [filenames-by-cad.js](https://github.com/tracespace/whats-that-gerber/blob/master/test/filenames-by-cad.js) to a JSON file and leave it where it is
2. Spin out the test case JSON file into its own node module hosted on npm and wherever else (GitHub releases would be easy)

What would be the easiest way for you guys to get and consume this JSON file?
